description: A Next.js + Tailwind CSS frontend with WordPress backend for blog management. Includes Home, About Us, Services, Blog, Portfolio, and Contact pages. Official colors: #2d46d6 and #b31e37.

rules.title: Setup Next.js + Tailwind CSS frontend
steps: Initialize Next.js project with TypeScript support
Install and configure Tailwind CSS
Setup project folder structure: /pages, /components, /styles, /lib
Configure global styles with official brand colors (#2d46d6, #b31e37)
rules.success_criteria: Next.js runs locally with Tailwind CSS applied and brand colors available as utilities.

rules.title: Configure WordPress backend for blog
steps: Install WordPress on hosting or localhost
Install and configure WPGraphQL or REST API plugin
Secure WordPress admin and limit functionality to blogging
Create sample blog posts to test API
rules.success_criteria: WordPress exposes blog content via API for frontend consumption.

rules.title: Integrate Next.js frontend with WordPress backend
steps: Connect Next.js frontend to WordPress API using fetch or Apollo Client
Create dynamic Blog page with post listing
Build single post template with SEO tags
Test data flow from WordPress to frontend
rules.success_criteria: Frontend blog pages display WordPress posts correctly.

rules.title: Build required static pages
steps: Design and implement Home page with hero section, services preview, and CTA
Create About Us page with mission and team info
Create Our Services page with structured cards
Build Portfolio page with grid layout
Add Contact Us page with form and email integration
rules.success_criteria: All required pages render correctly, styled with Tailwind, responsive, and accessible.

rules.title: Leverage AI throughout development
steps: Use AI to scaffold components, page templates, and API integration code
Generate Jest/React Testing Library tests with AI prompts
Draft docstrings and inline documentation using AI
Feed file diffs or directory trees into AI for context-aware refactoring
rules.success_criteria: AI accelerates dev tasks without breaking standards or introducing security issues.

rules.title: Deploy project to production
steps: Deploy frontend with Vercel or Netlify
Host WordPress backend securely (e.g., managed WordPress hosting)
Configure environment variables and API endpoints
Run final Lighthouse audit for performance and accessibility
rules.success_criteria: Website live with stable connection to WordPress backend, optimized for SEO and performance.
